p.s: I read the article about KLS goes green you sent me and I am happy to tell you about it.
KLS goes green is a project at my school, that was started because more and more students showed interest in protecting the environment and acting against climate change.
Especially through protests like Fridays-for-future the topic gained more popularity.
The school thought it would be nice to deal with questions like how does my acting affect the environment inside of school workshops.
Students, parents and teachers had the opportunity to request workshops, that they think could be interesting.
All the workshops, that they think could be interesting.
All the workshops will then take place at one day and there will be not normal lessons.
Examples for workshops that existed are discussing how to save water or a second hand flea market.
Another thing they did is making sure, that the trash is more environment friendly and they made a caf√© with vegan waffles and coffee.
One special thing they did is invite two poetry-slammers, one of which taught kids how to properly use their voice, helping them in discussions etc.
The teachers were very pleased with the event and it will probably take place again if it's possible due to COVID-19.
